contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} During [[World War II]], '''Operation Narcissus''' was a raid by forty members of the [[Special Air Service]] on a [[lighthouse]] on the southeast coast of [[Sicily]]. The team landed on 10 July 1943 with the mission of capturing the lighthouse and the surrounding [[high ground]]. Despite intelligence reports, the area was deserted, and so the position was no threat to the nearby [[Operation Husky|Husky]] landings. The troopers withdrew without a shot being fired. ==See also== * [[World War II]] * [[Special Air Service]] * [[Operation Husky]]: Allied invasion of Sicily. [[Category:Conflicts in 1943]] [[Category:World War II British Commando raids|N]] [[Category:Allied invasion of Sicily]] [[Category:Special Air Service|Narcissus]] {{UK-mil-stub}} {{WWII-stub}} {{British Commando raids of the Second World War}}
